Case reference: 2012020125.CaseDesc: Serge Crevier was last seen on July 17, 2006, around 1:30 pm at his residence in Gatineau. The car that he was using, a grey Oldsmobile Alero 2002, was found on September 10, 2006 in Thorne, in the Outaouais region.

Case reference: 2012020080.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2004, at 11:30 p.m., Courtney Struble, 13 years old, was last seen walking towards her residence in Estevan, SK. There have been reported sightings of Courtney, however, despite investigations and searches, she has not been located.

Mark: Neck, birthmark at nape of neck

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2006022299.CaseDesc: Nick Kostiuk was last seen in a boat leaving a dock on Lower Manitou Lake. He could not swim and his wife saw him leaving without a life jacket. Mr. Kostiuk has been presumed drowned.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire frame
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Accutron watch

Case reference: 2014003528.CaseDesc: Kate Huyghe was last seen in Killam, Alberta on February 21, 1976.

Boots: Leather, Black, winter boot with suede fur tops
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, family ring with colored stone

Case reference: 2013000027.CaseDesc: Nancy Joanne Forbes has not been seen or heard from since November 7, 2006. She was last seen at a bus stop on her way to a job interview in the Burnside Industrial Park in Dartmouth NS.

Case reference: 2014005328.CaseDesc: In October 1986, Frances Neilson was observed by family leaving her residence in Edmonton, Alberta in the family vehicle. A few days later the vehicle was recovered but Frances has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020078.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1990, Anthony Whitehead was last seen at a party on the Gordon's First Nation, Saskatchewan. Searches and investigation over the years have failed to locate Anthony.

Tattoo: Skull with top hat on one arm, unknown which arm
Middle Back, Skull and dragon, others
Left Hand, Phyllis Bluecloud covered to look like a bear

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Indigenous descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2018063460.CaseDesc: On October 13, 1992, at approximately 8:30 am, Debra Kumar was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022036924.CaseDesc: Paul Bellemore was last seen on video in Cornwall, Ontario, on July 29,2022.

Hat: Grey, Hurley brand dark grey ball cap

Case reference: 2006015499.CaseDesc: Richard Ranger was last seen on March 4, 1999, at Buster's Confectionary on Main Street in Haileybury.  Richard had been admitted to the Temiskaming Hospital for psychiatric assessment the same day he went missing and may suffer from mental illness. His whereabouts are unknown and foul play is not suspected at this time.

Case reference: 2015020897.CaseDesc: In April of 2015, Delmer Paul Bonnetrouge was seen for the last time in Fort Providence, Northwest Territories. He was reported missing by his family.

Case reference: 2010001999.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Dekleyn was last seen on December 3, 1992, at 1:35 p.m. on a Hamilton RBC bank surveillance camera, making a withdrawal from an ATM machine. Family have not seen or heard from him since and described Mr. Dekleyn as being depressed.

Jacket: Brown, with the Dempsters logo on the left chest
Scar: Torso (Front), Front-to-Back scar on abdomen from surgery to remove kidney.

Case reference: 2014000008.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2008, Christopher Hargitt, a resident of Vernon, BC, drove from Vernon to Vancouver. He was last seen by an associate, who was dropped off by Mr. Hargitt near the PNE Fairgrounds. On March 6, 2008, Christopher's vehicle was found unoccupied in East Vancouver, and he has made no contact with family or friends since that time. It is believed that Christopher may have run afoul of individuals involved in criminal activity, or fled the country to avoid these same persons.

Case reference: 2014004714.CaseDesc: In May 1975, William Lindsay was seen for the last time in Field, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, William, also known as Larry, had cashed in a federal tax refund cheque at a corner store. Prior to his disappearance in 1972, he had completed the Air Force’s basic training course (#7214) in Cornwallis, Nova Scotia, and then enrolled in the Communication Systems Tech course.

Scar: Cheek, Small crescent shaped on the left side

Case reference: 2013000051.CaseDesc: Darren Fortier was last seen hitchhiking in Port Hardy on the evening of December 30, 1998.  Mr. Fortier had been involved in a serious injury a few years earlier which had left him with a metal plate and pins in his leg and a brain injury.

Hat: Cotton, Blue, Maroon, Colorado Avalanche Baseball Cap
Foreign Object: Left Thigh, Surgical Implant, Plate and 5 screws
Scar: Chin, Distinct on the left side of chin
Cheek, Down the right side of the face
Nose, Across the bridge of the nose

Case reference: 2014003896.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, at approximately 3:30 p.m., Johanne Couture was seen for the last time when she left the Hôtel-Dieu Hospital in Lévis, Quebec. The following day, Johanne’s purse was found in the Chaudière Falls Park in Lévis.

Case reference: 2011000399.CaseDesc: Kathy Bordato was reported missing in early February, 2010.  Police believe that she was last seen on or about August 16, 2009, between 7:00 and 8:30 am in the area of Cavendish Park near Walnut Street in London, Ontario. Police conducted a search of the area where Ms. Bordato was last seen and believe there are still witnesses with information to offer in relation to the investigation.

Tattoo: Left Hand, Tattoo of female  symbol between thumb and finger, left hand

Case reference: 2014005988.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2013, Mark Clarke was seen for the last time in Kentville, Nova Scotia. It is out of character for Mark not to be in contact with his family for an extended period of time.

Case reference: 2021017400.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2021, at approximately 12:15 a.m., Saniyya Dennis was seen for the last time on the pedestrian bridge leading to Goat Island in Niagara Falls, New York. Saniyya sent a last text message at 1:23 a.m., from the Goat Island and Luna Island area.

Hat: Black, KNIT, White lettering on the brim
Shoes: Black, White, Black and white check "VANS" shoes
Sweater: Black, HOODIE, White lettering on the left side of chest and across the back

Case reference: 2009003899.CaseDesc: Investigation revealed that Emile Ruger, who resides on Brookdale Ave., had not paid his rent for the month of March and April 2008.  Mr. Ruger usually pays his rent three days in advance to the month due. He was last seen mid-February 2008 and his whereabouts are unknown. Last Seen: Rooming House on Brookdale Avenue

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014004727.CaseDesc: Roger Belanger was last seen in May of 1984, in the Peace River, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2014003138.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1981, John Sanderson was with some friends in Berens River, Manitoba.  He left in a 22' boat heading for Jackhead, Manitoba.  Friends tried to stop him from leaving due to the high winds but he left anyway. On October 19, 1981, the boat that he had taken was found upside down and partly submerged near the shore of Pigeon Point. Gas cans that had been in the boat were also located.  Searches were done by air and water but the body of John was never found. It is presumed that Mr. Sanderson drowned.

Case reference: 2014002108.CaseDesc: Craig Waldum along with 7 others were on a canoeing expedition along the Nelson River. Craig was one of two guides on the expedition. On August 18, 1978, three members of the expedition were on shore guiding in a canoe. The remaining 5 members including Craig remained in the canoe. As these individuals labored to guide the canoe to shore, the rope was given some slack. This caused the bow of the canoe to turn out into the current, which in turn caused the canoe to tip. The individuals on shore were unable to hold onto the rope due to the strength of the current and the canoe was carried downstream. Craig hung onto the canoe for a couple hours then was seen letting go. He slipped under the water and did not resurface. Mr. Waldum's remains have not been recovered and foul play is not suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2001002010.CaseDesc: Stephanie Cyr was last seen on June 5, 1998 at her home in Saint-Basile, New Brunswick.

Jacket: Green, orange and yellow plaid jacket
Skirt: Black and white stripped velvet skirt.

Case reference: 2014004156.CaseDesc: On July 17,1975, Helen Jordan was last seen on a bench outside of 84 South Cumberland Street in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Prior to the time of her disappearance, Helen was known to frequent that area.

Case reference: 2022017854.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2022, Laura Huebner was last seen at the Victoria International airport in Sidney, British Columbia.  Sometime later that same day, she had travelled to Nanaimo. Laura has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Long sandy blonde hair

Case reference: 2014004724.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2004, Corey Braun traveled from Fort St. John, B.C. to attend his employer's Christmas Party held at the Peace Valley Inn in Peace River, Alberta. On November 21, 2004, at 3:00 a.m., Corey was last seen walking to his room at the Peace Valley Inn by fellow employees. Corey has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Denim, Blue, light blue jean jacket

Case reference: 2014004475.CaseDesc: On the morning of October 1, 1976, Crystal Van Huuksloot was seen for the last time with her suitcases in Toronto, Ontario. Crystal had traveled from Edmonton, Alberta to help raise funds for her boyfriend. She stayed in Toronto for one week, but did not board her return flight to Edmonton.

Case reference: 2006012699.CaseDesc: John James Semple lived in a retirement home on Yearly Road, Huntsville, Ontario.  He was last seen in Huntsville in January 1998.

Case reference: 2003006900.CaseDesc: Krzysztof Syrzycki was last seen in Coquitlam, British Columbia on June 29, 2002.

Case reference: 2007004499.CaseDesc: Rod Pavan was last heard from on August 10, 2007. Mr. Pavan advised his landlord that he was moving to British Columbia that day. His vehicle was later found near Shannon Lake Road, north of Val Cote, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021044031.CaseDesc: David-Alexandre Beliveau was reported missing on September 27, 2021 and was last known to be in Calgary, Alberta on September 4, 2021. David has a number of unique tattoos on his hands, arm and back.

Hair: Brown, Wears a full brown beard
Tattoo: Torso (Front), Map of the Province of Quebec
Torso (Back), 3 Monkeys (See no evil, hear no evil and speak no evil)
Right Hand, Smiley face symbol on back of hand
Left Hand, Dice on back of hand

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2014001277.CaseDesc: On July 26, 1987, Sukhminder Singh Grewal was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. He came to Canada and performed as a singer in an East Indian Music Troupe that toured across the country. Sukhminder has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018053584.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1996, at approximately 1:30 p.m., Esther Adam was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Esther had made arrangements to meet with a friend on May 18, at 10:00 a.m., but did not attend.

Mark: Nose, Blue mark on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2022060389.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2021, Pitseolak Pootoogook was seen for the last time in Kinngait, Nunavut. During the time of his disappearance, Pitseolak was seen walking on the ice towards the mountains.

Case reference: 2014004419.CaseDesc: Holly Painter was initially reported as a missing person on June 26, 1995. On that evening, two friends of Holly's reported that they were at her residence when an argument broke out between Holly and one of the friends. They said that Holly assaulted that friend; the other friend then took Holly from the residence. All 3 of them left in the second friend's vehicle, with him driving. He reported that he intended to take Holly to her parents' residence, however, while making a left turn at an intersection, she jumped out of the vehicle and ran off.

Case reference: 2012020079.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1991, Lavina Tocher was last seen in Parkman, Saskatchewan. On the 12th of December of that year, she was reported missing. Investigation and searches have failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2020018331.CaseDesc: Riley Berland went missing from Frog Lake, Alberta, on May 31, 2020. Riley's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2019073733.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2019, Trevor Batoche was seen for the last time in Penticton, British Columbia. Trevor was known to frequently travel to Northern British Columbia and Edmonton, Alberta, possibly driving an older black pickup truck.

Case reference: 2022012467.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1988, Paul Moore was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Lewiston, New York. His vehicle was subsequently found abandoned in a parking lot near the American Falls. During the time of his disappearance, Paul was despondent.

Case reference: 2007002399.CaseDesc: Marilyn Neely was last seen by a friend on September 18, 1983, driving Southbound on Goodfellow Road, in the county of Peterborough. Her vehicle, a 1975 Dodge Dart, was later found on the Five Point Trail access road approximately 11 km west of Hwy #507. That same day a woman matching her description was seen walking west along the road from that location.

Purse: Green, White, vinyl with a white shoulder strap

Case reference: 2014004497.CaseDesc: It is believed Vernon Resch may have travelled to British Columbia.  He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017070923.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2017, Yoseph Birhanu-Baynesagn left his home in the middle of the night. The following day, Yoseph called his cousin from Union Station to let him know that he was coming for a visit. He never made it to his cousin's.

Case reference: 2014006160.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, George Heys left his residence for an appointment in Toronto, Ontario. George has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014005245.CaseDesc: Ka Hung Mok, was last seen by a family member around June 15, 1995 in Lasalle, Québec. He left the family home alone by car. The family later discovered that the vehicle had returned to the driveway, but Ka Hung was not seen and has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2022049575.CaseDesc: On September 30,2022, Lawrence Bertrim was last seen on foot in the downtown core of Smiths Falls, Ontario. It is believed that he was met with foul play.

Jewelry: Other, Rings, Text "If you don't like it go f**k yourself"
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Chinese symbol of the birth year

Case reference: 2014003060.CaseDesc: Pierre Lagacé was last seen on January 5, 2003. At the time, he was living in the Ville Lemoyne sector of Longueuil, Québec. Mr. Lagacé was reported missing by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, he had little money and no car in his name.

Case reference: 2021011416.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2021, Solange Bergeron was seen for the last time as she was drifting uncontrollably in the St. Lawrence River, near the Laviolette Park, in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance, Solange was despondent.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Straight, Long and straight

Case reference: 2014001875.CaseDesc: On May 25th, 1987 at approximately 9:00 a.m., Rene Parr left his home in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, where he was living with his sister for the previous 6 months. He was in the process of a divorce and he was scheduled to attend the courthouse the next day. Rene has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005821.CaseDesc: Jacques Joseph Duguay was reported missing on May 31, 1982 from Saint John, New Brunswick. On May 25th, 1982, his vehicle, a 1975 Chevrolet half-ton pickup truck was towed from Berry Mills highway just outside Moncton, New Brunswick. The vehicle had been there since May 21st, 1982.

Case reference: 2014001313.CaseDesc: On August 26, 1976, at 11:00 pm, Frederick Seymour was seen for the last time as he stood outside of his residence in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Seymour had been seen by his neighbour.

Case reference: 2019012883.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Semach was last seen on June 24, 1962, between 9 and 10 a.m., leaving her Niagara Falls, Ontario home. Elizabeth hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003020.CaseDesc: On October 7, 1997, Judy Desjarlais and a friend were sitting outside of their shared residence on Cameron Ave, Edmonton, overlooking the North Saskatchewan River. Judy took off running down towards the river. Her friend heard Judy in the river calling for help and went into the water looking for her.

Mark: Chin, Mole on left side of chin
Waist, 2 moles, 1 on each side of the stomach
Scar: Chin, Noticeable scar on left chin

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2023054349.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2023, Kyrylo Yeltsov was reported missing from the IUSMM - Pavillon Bédard in the Mercier-Hochelaga-Maisonneuve District of Montréal, Québec. He hasn't spoken to his mother or any of his friends since, and he's never returned to the hospital. Kyrylo is originally from Ukraine and was feeling despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Black, Bald, Black hair, currently bald

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska, Saskatchewan. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating Thomas and Lawrence.

Case reference: 2024049833.CaseDesc: Sheryl Rucci was last seen on August 9, 2005, shortly after 9 pm, at her residence in Lockport, New York, USA.

Tattoo: Unknown, A rose, Ashley on one ankle

Case reference: 2013000046.CaseDesc: On June 27, 2004, Richard McGuire was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle was found in a garage located in the municipality of St-Elzear in the La Nouvelle-Beauce Regional County in Quebec.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2014005677.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2011, John Fadden was last seen in the University Endowment Lands, British Columbia.  He also suffered from dementia.

Case reference: 2006011299.CaseDesc: Henry Atlookan left Whiteclay Lake in a canoe to travel 55 km to Armstrong, Ontario. He may have been seen on June 25, 1968 making a purchase at a local store in the Town of Armstrong. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003388.CaseDesc: Janet Henry was a resident of Vancouver's downtown east side; she struggled with mental health and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Despite her challenges, Ms. Henry kept in frequent contact with her family. She was last seen on June 25, 1997, and was reported missing two days later.

Case reference: 2006003699.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2002, a male, believed to be between the ages of 30 to 40 years old, was found in the Don River, north of the Queen Street East Bridge. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 217 lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Full gold crown lower right first molar, a dental implant replacing upper right central incisor, multiple amalgam restorations.
Shirt: Red, T-shirt with indistinguishable white lettering

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2006009599.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Ann Kant has been missing since October 16, 1972. She had been with a hunting party in Adair Township, approximately 73 miles east of Cochrane and was last seen about 2.4 miles south of Camp # 23, Abitibi limits.

Jacket: Black, Red, men's plaid hunting jacket
Jewelry: Gold, White, Yellow, ring; wedding band
Pants: Green, Ski slacks with elastic strap under the feet
Scar: Right Foot, from bone spur surgery

Case reference: 2014006050.CaseDesc: On April 3, 2013, Mr. Patrice Mathieu was reported missing from his home in St-Joseph-de-Sorel. He was last seen the day before. Mr. Mathieu does not own a car, however he does have a driver's licence. Mr. Mathieu usually travels on foot. He is quiet and is, by nature, anxious and withdrawn.

Coat: Black, Mid-thigh length with a hood

Case reference: 2013000073.CaseDesc: Monique Heneault was last seen on June 4, 1986, in Montreal. Mme Heneault lived by herself in an apartment. It seems as though she left her apartment suddenly because there were left overs from her meal found on the table and counter. She had rented a chalet in Labelle, but never arrived.

Case reference: 2020041548.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2020, Horacio Calderon Alvidrez was last seen moving out from his residence in New Westminster, British Columbia. Horacio has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020037.CaseDesc: The last known whereabouts of John Old Shoes is that he was camping in the Blood Reserve Timber limits area. This area is located between the Waterton Lakes National Park and the Chief Mountain Border Crossing in southern Alberta. He was last seen on 1 April 2001.

Case reference: 2006013899.CaseDesc: Robert Heintz went missing from Kearns, Ontario on the morning of December 1, 1982.  Mr. Heintz went into the bush behind Larder Lake Public School with some friends and became separated from them.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005606.CaseDesc: Larry Duck of Tadoule Lake was last seen in April of 2011, in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Larry has not made contact with his family since. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014004478.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004, Norman Halkett was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Elbow, Transverse fracture across base of olecranon

Case reference: 2018054233.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2018, Xinye Wang was last seen in China. Xinye was scheduled to return to Canada but has not been heard from or seen since.

Case reference: 2014001532.CaseDesc: Gavin Edkins was last observed departing the Fort McMurray International Airport in Alberta on May 19, 1996, piloting a red and white Cessna aircraft bound for Red Deer, Alberta. The plane did not make it to its intended destination. Gavin and the plane haven't been located.

Coat: Leather, Black, With red liner - size 38
Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch, "Timex" brand
Gold, Gold, Chain, With float plane
Gold, Gold, Ring, On left pinky finger

Case reference: 2014004809.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Peterson was reported missing on August 7, 2006, by a family member.  Investigators were advised that Mr. Peterson's vehicle was not taken and that he does not have a history of leaving without first communicating with them. It was later determined that Mr. Peterson was last seen by a neighbor, close to his residence in Manitou, Manitoba, on the afternoon of August 5, 2006.  Numerous searches were conducted of Manitou and the surrounding area, none of which were successful.

Case reference: 2014002240.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1993, Marcus Laing was reported missing when he failed to show up for work which was out of character for him.

Case reference: 2011000499.CaseDesc: In August 1996, Bruce Berthelot left his family residence in Leamington, Ontario. M. Berthelot indicated that he was going away for a little while and asked his mother for $1000. He had been unemployed for several months and was dealing with some health issues. Prior to leaving he telephoned his friends in Manitoba a number of times. His family believes that he was headed to Western Canada. He has lived in Manitoba in the past. Mr. Berthelot is a skilled carpenter, and enjoys fishing and boating.  He has had no contact with any members of his family or friends since leaving.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2019009625.CaseDesc: On August 12, 2018, Nikhil Arun was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018041276.CaseDesc:
John Russell Kenny, originally from Ontario, resided without a fixed address in Vancouver, British Columbia. 
Mr. Kenny was known for travelling by train.

Case reference: 2022041482.CaseDesc: Henry McAdam, originally from the Big River First Nation in Saskatchewan, was last seen on July 14,2022 in the area of Prince Albert. He was reported missing by a family member on July 24, 2022. Henry adopted a transient and high-risk lifestyle and he is known for using housing resources for the homeless. There is no indication of foul play at this time.

Case reference: 2014003811.CaseDesc: On December 28, 1988, Murray Copp was seen for the last time at the Salvation Army Community and Family Services Centre in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Scar: Nose, Between eyes and above nose

Case reference: 2014003679.CaseDesc: In December 1983, Konrad Murach was last seen by his family. Since this time, Konrad has not been seen nor has anyone heard from him.

Case reference: 2014004681.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1965, Archie Laroque was hunting with six other people near Laroque Lake, 48 kilometers east of Carrot River, SK. The hunting party split up and Archie was last seen walking in an area alone. Extensive ground and air searches were conducted, however, Archie was never located.

Case reference: 2014005200.CaseDesc: Conrad Hastings was last seen at the bus shelter at Smith Street and Portage Avenue.  His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2013000034.CaseDesc: Lucie Constantineau was last seen on July 25, 2008 in the Parc-Extension in Montreal, Quebec. Lucie was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Teeth: Braces, partial denture on the 4 front teeth of the upper jaw
Amputation: Right Ear, Missing part of an ear lobe

Case reference: 2018061754.CaseDesc: Jessica Malouf-Pelletier left her parents' home in St.-Sulpice, Quebec, on an undetermined Friday evening in September 2017. Jessica was picked up in a dark vehicle driven by an unknown person and has not been seen since. She was only reported missing to the police in March 2018. Jessica was known for living a high-risk lifestyle and she had previously expressed her intent to relocate to Ontario and earn money.

Hair: Blonde, Blonde hair, sometimes dyed red

Case reference: 2021030286.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2021, Mona Hu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Mona had been in contact with her family in China, and was arranging to travel to see them.

Case reference: 2014005291.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1990, at approximately 6:50am, Ann Lylyck was last seen by her friend when he dropped her and her dog off at the Our Lady of Mercy Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. Ann was intending on visiting her aunt, but wanted to walk her dog before going into the hospital. When her friend returned a few hours later, Ann could not be located.
